Text.Value: Only one Chosen remains - and that's still one too many.
Boo is enjoying this chasing of Chosen. Let us find the last, so he might take another trophy.
*Your companion did not survive to witness your triumph - all life within was extinguished by Orin's blades. But you still live.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shot tbc - possibly player reaction, sad thought to self

Text.Value: Find Gortash. And take his Netherstone.
The great Archduke is awaiting word of Orin's demise, no doubt.
Gortash will be delighted to hear of Orin's death, but be ready for anything when we report to him. If he is to betray us, that would be the time.

EditorData.NodeContext: playing the role of advisor, and advising caution

Text.Value: Examine the blood with dismay - this will take forever to come out.

EditorData.logicalname: Gortash Stone was picked up before.

Text.Value: Just one Chosen remains. Let's endeavour to make that none, shall we?
Only one Chosen remains. For now.
Smile. Bhaal will rejoice in your slaughter here.
Two Chosen down, one still to go. Shall we pay a visit to Gortash?
Mourn the child you did not save. Swear her death will not be in vain.
Oh, goodie. Now we can go see Gortash, dangle this stone in front of him, and watch him beg before we slit his throat... right?
To Gortash, then. I'm sure his enthusiasm will be... boundless.
Bring on the next. You'll cut them all down to size.
We should pay Gortash a visit. Let's see if he keeps his word.
Smile. Lady Shar will be pleased.
Smile. Your own dark master will be pleased.

EditorData.logicalname: CLERIC EVIL (NOT ENEMY OF SHAR SH)

Text.Value: Gortash will want to hear of this.
Be content. Baldur's Gate may never be pure, but cutting out Bhaal's roots is a boon to nature.
*A glint of light on something in the blood catches your eye.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Orin's dagger in the pool of blood where her corpse was.

Text.Value: *A metallic tang fills the air as Orin's form is drained of life - ashes to ashes, blood to blood.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [SLAYER] Collapses to the ground and writhes in pain before disintegrating into a puddle of gore and blood.<CodyM>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Human Orin falls to the ground and bubbles down into a pool of blood with a giggle. Giggle is being recorded in LOW_BhaalTemple_Orin

Text.Value: Seek him out. He is all that stands between us and the elder brain.
Only one left to slaughter now. It's quite the habit we're building.
Another Bhaalspawn falls - leaving only the final Chosen.
Mourn your fallen ally. Swear his death will not be in vain.
Stand back and admire a job well done.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [PLAYER] Steps up to the pile of gore and pulls out Orin's dagger, holding it up for inspection.<CodyM>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player picks up the dagger from the pool of blood.
EditorData.logicalname: Player picks up dagger from pool of blood

Text.Value: One more Chosen to go. Can't wait.
I'm sure Gortash will be eager to learn of his rival's demise.
Time to pay Gortash another visit. I'm sure he'll want to know all about this.
*You have robbed another god of his Chosen.*
*A metallic tang fills the air as the Slayer's form is drained of life - ashes to ashes, blood to blood.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [SLAYER] Collapses to the ground and writhes in pain before disintegrating into a puddle of gore and blood.<CodyM>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Orin as slayer falls to the ground and bubbles down into a pool of blood with a giggle. Giggle is being recorded as node

Text.Value: Her Netherstone...
*The child did not survive to witness your triumph - all life within her was extinguished by Orin's blades. But you still live.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shot tbc - possibly player reaction, sad thought to self

Text.Value: Mourn your fallen ally. Swear her death will not be in vain.
I wish there were time to celebrate her death, but one Chosen still stands. Gortash is our next target.

EditorData.NodeContext: minor irritation, but complete commitment to the cause (of killing the Chosen)

Text.Value: Only one more remains, and then we will be ready to pursue the elder brain.
Only Bane's Chosen remains. Let us see he meets the same fate.
The final Netherstone...
Reflect on your technique - it could have been better.
Gortash wanted this stone. If we must give it to him... may we wrap it in a fist?
Gortash will be keen to hear of this.

Synopsis: Orin, Chosen of Bhaal has died by the hands of players.
